research.name: Carnegie Mellon University
research.summary: Leveraging machine learning to uncover mechanisms involved in cellular senescence and aging.

research.name: University of Pittsburgh Medical Center (UPMC)
research.summary: Performing gene knockout/overexpression experiments and Bleomycin-induced DNA damage to determine causal effects of marker genes on cellular senescence.

work.name: Sanofi
work.summary: Analyzed longitudinal gene expression data from patients with a few time points.

work.name: Genesis Therapeutics
work.summary: Researched and developed deep generative models for de novo drug design, optimizing for novelty and diversity of molecules.

work.name: Ritech
work.summary: Proposed and implemented novel computer vision models for various tasks such as monocular depth estimation, image classification, and image segmentation.

work.name: Centroida
work.summary: Investigated deep learning methods for real-time face detection and developed face tracking algorithms.

awards.title: 4th place at the NeurIPS AutoML Decathlon Competition
awards.summary: Developed an AutoML pipeline that performed well on ten diverse tasks.

organizations.name: NIH Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet) Consortium
organizations.position: Member - Consortium Organization and Data Coordinating Center (CODCC)
organizations.summary: Developing methods to discover senescence biomarkers as a member of the Biomarker Working Group.

organizations.name: NIH Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Consortium
organizations.position: Member - Platform Development and Data Analysis Team
organizations.summary: Developed software tools to enable large-scale collaborations, integration, and comparisons across many different single-cell omics platforms and modalities.

organizations.name: Mathematics Club (Polygon)
organizations.summary: Organized several events including talks by students and professors, mathematics competitions, and social events between math students and professors.
